qas.question: What appointments were  the first step in Indian self-rule?
When was the first Indian appointed as a Councillor?
What more local councils were set up?
Of what nationality were the officers in the Indian Army?
What were the troops in the British Indian Army?

context: The first step toward Indian self-rule was the appointment of <a0_0>councillors<a0_0/> to advise the British viceroy in 1861 and the first Indian was appointed in <a1_0>1909<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Provincial Councils<a2_0/> with Indian members were also set up. The councillors' participation was subsequently widened into legislative councils. The British built a large British Indian Army, with the senior officers all <a3_0>British<a3_0/> and many of the troops from small <a4_0>minority groups<a4_0/> such as Gurkhas from Nepal and Sikhs. The civil service was increasingly filled with natives at the lower levels, with the British holding the more senior positions.
